annotation.TEXT: Now, if you're on Easy or Normal, you can just hop down unobstructed here, but on Hard or Lunatic, you'll be taking a more roundabout route. You can't even try going over the top on these two levels!

Wow, I used up almost all of my time limit during the level! I initially had it set to 600 to start with, but I upped it to 712 when I kept running out of time while trying to access every secret in one run during testing.
Try to get up here fast before the rainbow shell starts coming at you. Once up here, collect the Yoshi coin, then you can hit the P-switch and race down through the brown blocks to the door.
You can still use the shell to clean out these blocks like last time. However, now I want to rewind and go hit that P-switch.
If you can just hit this block before it's eaten, you're good. The P-switch it holds will eventually fall down to you, so it's unnecessary to jump up for it after revealing it.

Now, when navigating through these pipes, on Easy, the first piranha will get jammed in the green blocks above (which is intended), while on Hard and Lunatic, the path gets narrower in certain places.
Meh, I got two out of five. That's okay I guess.
Can't go the note block way, so we've gotta climb up!
Only Lunatic should have to worry about this fuzzy.
Let's quickly take a P-switch all the way to the switch room at the end.

Important things to do during the P-switch effect: Hit the other turn block for a second P-switch (but don't hit it now), and get the Yoshi coin. The remaining time can be used to get as many coins as you can.

Now, the next P-switch door is nearby, but first, absolutely collect this Yoshi coin! It should be your fifth one, but if you don't get it now, it won't be there after you clean out the next bonus room.
In here, drop down, but hold right and jump from where you land to get a hidden 1-up. Then, continue down and try to make it to the turn block in the middle as fast as you can.
If you hit them in the proper order, you can access the upper part of this room, where the good stuff is!

Obviously, you can't go down that pipe, so you have to go right. It's pretty tame on Easy and Normal, and even Hard shouldn't have too much trouble, but Lunatic... Let's just say that the bonus room is a far better option!
Ah, there's switch blocks to the left. If you're on any level other than Easy, you can access a bonus room over here!
I think I got a bit lucky back there!
And, that's it for this bonus room. Go through the pipe below to return to the switch room.
Yeah, regardless of which switch you hit, the blocks coming out on the overworld will look yellow. I don't think there's anything I can do about that.
Lunatic is even more restricting, and nearly impossible to do while super!
Upon exiting that bonus room, you return back to this spot. Now, you might be tempted to try repeating that bonus room, but...
However, by hitting the P-switch early like that, I kind of screwed over my chance to get this Yoshi coin as well, so let's not do that.
Whoa! Watch out, dude! Depending on the level you're playing at, this part could be easy or tricky!
The blocks still come out yellow on the overworld, regardless of which one you stomp. Also, the palace isn't automatically destroyed, so you can walk right back in and hit more switches if you want!
Hit the P-switch, then collect some coins! Make sure to go to the left so you can collect a 1-up that falls down, and also don't forget to grab the 1-up and flower on the clouds to the right.
Of course, you can exit off the left edge of the screen here in case you change your mind or you've already hit them all.

I didn't do that with any other Yoshi coin, though, so that one in the lava cave near this bonus room's entrance would be gone if you didn't get it before entering this bonus room and you got the one here as your fifth.
On Hard, the top two are completely blocked off, and the ones on the sides are harder to reach.
Enter the door when you're done here and you'll end up right near midpoint.

However, you'll likely miss out on a bonus room (it's in that P-switch door that you might've briefly saw). Now, maybe I could've reached the door in time, but I'm going to show the standard route here first.
...then hop across platforms on my initials to reach a couple 1-ups in the upper-right.

So, instead, let's not do that. (By the way, that bonus room can also be reached on the first trip through the level, but you don't have to worry about Yoshi coin collecting order there, since you can't get more than 4 then anyway.)
Now, this is the pipe you'd normally go in on your second trip. However...
Everybody will have to deal with this fuzzy to reach the Yoshi coin though, but there should be at least one shell available.
Okay, now let's enter this bonus room.
Here is the solution, which involves skipping blocks in a couple places.
But, let's say I wanted to play the level with both red and blue active. Now I can, by just waltzing over and stomping the blue switch here.
Push!
Hey, this place looks familiar! Yep, these two bonus areas are connected. That's the reason for the way the other entrance to this room worked.
It's a ghost house, with an Eerie generator, but don't fret. Hit the first block and you'll get a star! Now you can go whack some ghosts while hitting the other blocks.
Now, get on top of this wall and leap to the clouds again.
D'oh! Need another shell. Note that on Lunatic, you'll have a couple of extra koopas kicking shells at you here.
This one involves ON/OFF blocks.
And, with the level completely done, we can now access...
Here in the forest again, the method to get to the flower in the upper-left is unchanged for Hard, made easier for Easy and Normal, and made tougher (but not impossible) for Lunatic.
And we're back here. Now, the difficulty really has an impact on this area. Lunatic would have to pull off some ridiculous stunts, but Hard isn't too terrible.
It's a little trickier, but not too bad.
Starts off the same, although this power up block would be obstructed on Lunatic, but you could still hit it with a shell.

Yes, that upper-left turn block is just a turn block, but the upper-right one has a 1-up. Also, the Eeries don't seem to spawn above a certain height, so you're probably safe going for the coins above, even after the star ends.
Um, oops! I made a mistake with the MAP16. I know what I did wrong, too. Fortunately, I don't think I used that tile anywhere in the contest level, so my score shouldn't be affected by that.
And there we go! You can get a couple flowers in the upper-left...
Push! Now, drop down through the brown block (which was the multi-coin block you hopefully cleaned out ahead of time), then head straight for the P-switch door below.
Obviously, start controlling Mario again before bad things happen, and enter the door.
I've already hit red, so that's why the red switch isn't present here.
This should provide a good challenge, but won't be insanely difficult in some places like Lunatic can be, and I can still access every secret that can be accessed on the second visit.

See that door up there? That's how you'd reach the same bonus room that I'm going to show in a moment on Lunatic, but it's trickier to do. On Hard, though, the door to that bonus room is down here. (Note: Easy and Normal can't reach this bonus room at all.)

Alright, it's boss time! Hit the big boo with three ice blocks like usual. However, the difficulty level will affect things here again! In particular, Hard and Lunatic restrict your access to ice blocks.
You get a 1-up just for entering, but don't stand around lollygagging! Quickly, climb up these blocks as fast as you can!

Well, I hope you enjoyed watching me play my vanilla contest level, Switch Block City! It probably can't compete with the best of the best, but I think it should still do fairly well. What do you guys think?
These jumps right here are no problem on Easy or Normal, a bit tougher on Hard, and Kaizo-like on Lunatic!
When you're done here, go down the pipe on the right, and make sure to bring the P-switch with you.

Now, this is the boss room, but if you carry something into it, the boss won't spawn. In the case of the P-switch, hitting it will flood the room with coins, on both layers! But, be very careful of spikes and Eeries while getting rich!
Hit it, then hit the P-switch that appears right away!
Then, you can activate it and take a small shortcut. Also, watch the upper-right corner as I stomp it.
Save your progress if you want, then head back into Switch Block City again.
This room autoscrolls pretty quickly. There's no way you're gonna be able to get every coin, so concentrate on hitting the turn blocks for 1-ups as fast as you can.

Now, remember this luck-based moon from my first trip? Well, if you've played out the previous 1-up chamber from near the beginning of the level, you'll automatically fail all attempts you make here, which is what you want!
Now, if you're playing on Easy or Normal, you can easily get the star block to the left from here.
Okay, but now we need to actually fight the boss. Good thing the entry pipe is a reset pipe! Just don't be carrying anything when you enter it.
Yeah, now the moon can be gotten guaranteed! (It is actually possible you could get lucky and get it the first time around though, but do all this anyway for a bunch of coins and the extra P-switch.)
Another bonus room!

If you climb to the top during the P-switch effect, you'll see coins forming Tetris shapes. Also, for those wondering how the Yoshi coin was able to appear here, I inserted this one (and the final one) as MAP16 tiles, not as objects, so they'll always appear.
Instead of hitting this P-switch immediately, you can use it to open up this power up block from the left, allowing collection of the power up on Hard.
For this part, the first three difficulties will ride the raft this way (though Easy won't need it), but Lunatic won't have the raft here and will have to bounce off enemies to proceed!
It's not impossible to get the star block from here on Hard or Lunatic, though. If you take this buzzy over to the left, and aim carefully...
The setup here varies depending on the difficulty, but everyone but Easy can get the final Yoshi coin (which is inserted as MAP16 tiles again).
Can't exactly grab a shell from down here, but anyone other than Lunatic can still use these ice blocks to at least get another power up if they want (and a couple coins from the other block too).
Instead, let's take the P-switch, use it to open the power up block if you want, then go around the normal way and get the Yoshi coin before activating it.
Ow! Stupid Eerie... Gotta be very careful of them!
Oh, there's one more bonus room I almost forgot to show you guys. This is back on the first trip through the level (it can't be reached on the second visit, due to where it is).
This area might look familiar. It's reachable on the first visit, as I showed last time, but it's a main part of the second visit.
Now, as usual, don't stomp the second P-switch yet. Instead, take it through the pipe.
Oh, "GYRB"! Of course!
Hard loses a little bit of head room, but it's nothing major.
A second P-switch will also fall down, but don't hit it here. Hang onto it for later.
It's not too restricting on Hard, though.

Those parakoopas up there can almost be ignored on the lesser difficulties, or you can try using one of them as a weapon if you want, but Lunatic would need to bounce off those guys straight to the Hammer Bro's platform!
Now, if you're playing casually and don't care about secrets, you could just hit the P-switch immediately and get the coins again, same way as before...
Now, by bringing a P-switch here, you can perform the block factory glitch with the multi-coin block!
Also, these red blocks here can be jumped over to quickly get the Yoshi coin from this side. I wouldn't try that on Lunatic though!
Going down this pipe takes you to the middle of the lava cave room, but now I want to rewind and hit the P-switch, like usual.

However, you do kind of want to watch out for this shell flying around down here! It'll only move this way on Hard. Other difficulties will have a different setup going on. (Yes, that's the sole intended purpose of that wall triangle!)
And that's game! And, since this is technically a vertical level, the action freezes instantly once the victory theme starts (so you won't get cheaply crushed during fadeout or anything like that).
Using the goomba to remove one of them is a good idea. (Or you could just screen scroll to despawn them all.)
This is also a way to reach this Yoshi coin and mushroom.
Also, don't collect all the coins, obviously.
Hmm... Can't reach the flower from here. Also, this passage is narrower, so the parakoopas here might be trickier to deal with.
There we go! But, before I hit the P-switch, I want to show the standard route like usual. (Note: This P-switch is blocked off completely on Easy.)
Now, I whacked the goomba there, so I'll need a shell to access the P-switch now. In such a case, it would be a good idea to break the turn block on the right ahead of time.
And, I do believe that was the last bonus room I needed to show off!

As you're going through the pipe, let go of the controls, and you'll stomp it almost immediately in the next room, which will reveal yet another secret door! (This can be done on the first trip through the level as well.)
That's weird. How come the shell didn't work on it the first time there?
Oops. Well, obviously, I messed up somewhere, but no worries. Go back to the left, and the platform should respawn!
And you plop out right here, so you won't have missed much, except for a few coins. Now, due to the switch blocks, you can't go down, so you'll have to take a different route!
I still want to show that bonus room I skipped, so let's back up a bit...
Sweet!
Oh, but it's just another one of these rooms. However, play this room to completion anyway (success rate here doesn't matter). You'll see why later.

A couple notes: For level design contest purposes, anything involving this GYRB Switch Palace doesn't count. Also, I haven't tested every possible switch combination, so play at your own risk! (Mwahaha...)

Ah, now we can reach this Yoshi coin. Watch out for the Chucks, though! Easy and Normal will only have to deal with one Chuck, however. Also, the difficulty level determines how many buzzies will fall onto that rope.
Make sure you clean out that multi-coin block (and try not to get hurt like I did), then go left and eventually up.

There's a star in that block up there, but it's meant for Easy mode. Hard can open the block by hitting it with the P-switch, but you probably won't be able to collect the darned thing! (Lunatic actually can collect it, due to the blue blocks above it, but it's probably not as helpful as you'd think.)
I wouldn't waste time with the multi-coin block here. While invincible, you're better off ghost hunting, and when the star wears off, you probably shouldn't be lingering around this place!
But, more importantly, make your way to the right side of the room, then hit the P-switch. (Don't hit it too soon, or the coins on top will get in your way!)
Also, make sure to claim the P-switch from this last turn block!
If you're super (and you'd better be), break these turn blocks and collect some coins. Also, KO dry bones with the power up block if you can!
And now we arrive at the second raft again, but we're going a different way now! These rows of switch blocks ensure that you can't reach the switch palace room on the second visit.
However, before I hit the P-switch, I want to show the normal path on Hard here.
Don't. I made it so that the whole thing is blocked off the second time, meaning it's just a waste of a P-switch to revisit this room.
Clean it out, and carry the P-switch through the pipe, like usual.
...the "GYRB Switch Palace"? What's a "GYRB"?
Huh? Did I just pass through that corner tile?

Now, the pipe up there is pretty much blocked off, so you'll want to go down here instead. (Any level but Hard can technically still get in the upper pipe, but it's not the way to go if you're looking for secrets.)
Last time, I finished my first trip through the level, and I chose to step on the red switch, which is the Hard difficulty.
Now, I'll just tell you right now, there's a P-switch door right beneath that power up block I just hit, but if you want all the Yoshi coins as well, don't hit the P-switch yet.
Now, for those of you that want to play around with the level more at this point, you can try having multiple switches pressed at once!
